He added that on 11 February looters emptied a storage area in Dashur, an important ancient necropolis in the southern part of the famous cemetery at Saqqara, which contained large blocks and small artifacts. I am now concerned Egypt is not safe, he wrote. The thefts from the Egyptian Museum are likely to undermine Zahi Hawass 's long-standing efforts to have important artifacts, such as a bust of Nefertiti now in Berlin, returned to Cairo( 382).

Cairo had raised fears that the country could suffer the same loss of cultural heritage as occurred in Iraq in 2003 after the fall of Saddam Hussein . Egypt's cultural treasures are now secure, Zahi Hawass said. The Valley of the Kings is safe, the pyramids are safe, 24 museums are safe, the synagogues and the monasteries and the Muslim monuments are completely safe, he said.
